questions.text: The scientific study of insects is known as
questions.solution:
✅ **Correct Answer: Entomology (B)**

**Deep Explanation:** Entomology is the specialized scientific discipline within zoology that systematically studies **insects** — their classification, anatomy, physiology, ecology, behaviour, life cycles, and economic importance (as pollinators, pests, or disease vectors). It forms the basis for pest management, forensic entomology, and biodiversity studies.

**Option-wise Analysis:**
• **Ichthyology (A):** Study of **fishes** (marine & freshwater).
• **Parasitology (C):** Study of **parasites** and host-parasite relationships.
• **Malacology (D):** Study of **molluscs** (snails, clams, octopuses).

Mastering these terms helps differentiate major branches of zoology.

questions.text: Which of the following subjects of data set is associated with the study of concerning population and humanity?
questions.solution:
✅ **Correct Answer: Demography (C)**

**Deep Explanation:** Demography is the statistical and scientific study of **human populations** — size, density, distribution, age structure, birth/death rates, migration, and growth patterns. It is widely used in public health planning, economics, urbanization, and government policy making.

**Option-wise Analysis:**
• **Ecology (A):** Interactions between organisms and their environment.
• **Genetics (B):** Heredity and variation in living organisms.
• **Virology (D):** Study of **viruses** and viral diseases.

Demography is a distinct social science intersecting with biology.

questions.text: Study of Zoology deals with
questions.solution:
✅ **Correct Answer: Both living and dead animals (C)**

**Deep Explanation:** Zoology is the comprehensive scientific study of the entire **animal kingdom**, including living animals (physiology, behaviour, ecology) as well as extinct/fossil animals (palaeozoology, comparative anatomy of preserved specimens). This broad scope enables evolutionary studies.

**Option-wise Analysis:**
• **Living plants only (B):** This is Botany.
• **Both living and dead plants (D):** This is Palaeobotany + Botany.
• **Living animals only (A):** Incomplete definition.

The inclusive nature distinguishes Zoology from narrower fields.

questions.text: The study of the flower is known as
questions.solution:
✅ **Correct Answer: Anthology (B)**

**Deep Explanation:** Anthology (from Greek “anthos” = flower) is the branch of botany that specifically deals with the **structure, development, pollination biology, and classification of flowers** in angiosperms. It is crucial for horticulture, plant breeding, and taxonomy.

**Option-wise Analysis:**
• **Phrenology (A):** Discredited pseudoscience linking skull shape to personality.
• **Agrostology (C):** Study of **grasses** (Poaceae family).
• **Palynology (D):** Study of **pollen grains** and spores.

Anthology is a precise sub-discipline of reproductive botany.

questions.text: The comparative study of the different cultures and the scientific explanation is known as
questions.solution:
✅ **Correct Answer: Ethnology (A)**

**Deep Explanation:** Ethnology is the **comparative and analytical** branch of anthropology that scientifically explains similarities and differences among human cultures, social structures, customs, beliefs, and institutions across societies.

**Option-wise Analysis:**
• **Ethnography (B):** Descriptive fieldwork study of a **single** culture.
• **Ethology (C):** Scientific study of **animal behaviour**.
• **Ethics (D):** Philosophical study of **morality** and right/wrong.

Ethnology provides the scientific framework for cross-cultural understanding.

questions.text: The study of properties and method of biological systems found in nature and use of this knowledge in mechanical world is known as
questions.solution:
✅ **Correct Answer: Bionics (A)**

**Deep Explanation:** Bionics (also called biomimetics or biomimicry) is the science of applying **biological principles and designs** found in nature to solve engineering and technological problems (e.g., Velcro from burrs, aircraft wings from birds, self-cleaning surfaces from lotus leaves).

**Option-wise Analysis:**
• **Bionomics (B):** Study of organism-environment economic relationships.
• **Bionomy (C):** Laws governing life processes.
• **Biometry (D):** Statistical analysis of biological data.

Bionics drives innovation in robotics, materials science, and architecture.

questions.text: Under Palaeobotany, one studies
questions.solution:
✅ **Correct Answer: None of the above (D)**

**Deep Explanation:** Palaeobotany exclusively deals with the study of **fossil plants** (impressions, petrifactions, coal balls, pollen) to reconstruct ancient vegetation, climate, and plant evolution.

**Option-wise Analysis:**
• **Fossil of animals (A):** Palaeozoology.
• **Algae (B):** Phycology (living) or Palaeophycology (fossil algae).
• **Fungi (C):** Mycology (living) or Palaeomycology (fossil fungi).

This precise definition is vital in palaeontology and evolutionary biology.

questions.text: Rearing silk worms is known as
questions.solution:
✅ **Correct Answer: Sericulture (C)**

**Deep Explanation:** Sericulture is the agro-based industry involving controlled rearing of silkworms (**Bombyx mori**) on mulberry leaves for commercial production of raw silk. It includes cocoon harvesting and silk reeling.

**Option-wise Analysis:**
• **Apiculture (A):** Rearing of honey bees.
• **Horticulture (B):** Cultivation of garden plants/fruits/vegetables.
• **Floriculture (D):** Cultivation of flowering plants.

Sericulture is economically significant in India, China, and Japan.

questions.text: Honey bees are used in
questions.solution:
✅ **Correct Answer: Apiculture (C)**

**Deep Explanation:** Apiculture (beekeeping) involves managed colonies of honey bees (**Apis** species) for production of honey, beeswax, royal jelly, propolis, and pollination services in agriculture.

**Option-wise Analysis:**
• **Sericulture (A):** Silkworms.
• **Tissue culture (B):** In-vitro plant/animal cell growth.
• **Pisciculture (D):** Fish farming.

Apiculture also supports biodiversity through pollination.

questions.text: Which one of the following is not correctly matched?
questions.solution:
✅ **Correct Mismatch: Vegetable - Horticulture Cultivation (C)**

**Deep Explanation:** Vegetables are studied under **Olericulture**, a specialized branch. Horticulture is the broader science of garden crops including fruits, flowers, and ornamentals.

**Correct Matches:**
• Flower → **Floriculture**
• Field crops → **Agronomy**
• Fruits → **Pomology**

Precision in agricultural terminology is essential for competitive exams.

questions.text: Which of the following is not correctly matched?
questions.solution:
✅ **Correct Mismatch: Pisciculture - Insect of lakh (C)**

**Deep Explanation:** Pisciculture is commercial **fish farming**. The lac insect (**Kerria lacca**) is reared under **lac culture**, not pisciculture.

**Correct Matches:**
• Apiculture → Honey bee
• Sericulture → Silkworm
• Horticulture → Garden plants/flowers

This tests knowledge of specialized animal husbandry branches.

questions.text: Which of the following pairs is correctly matched? (word and meaning)
questions.solution:
✅ **Correct Pair: Lexicography - Compilation of dictionary (A)**

**Deep Explanation:** Lexicography is the art and science of **dictionary making** — collecting, defining, and organizing words.

**Incorrect Pairs:**
• Philology → Historical study of languages (not stamps; philately = stamp collection).
• Entomology → Study of insects (not human body; anatomy = human body).
• Iconography → Study of visual symbols/art (not insects).

Linguistic precision is key.

questions.text: Lexicography is related to
questions.solution:
✅ **Correct Answer: Compilation of dictionary (B)**

**Deep Explanation:** Lexicography involves systematic compilation, editing, and updating of **dictionaries** (e.g., Oxford English Dictionary).

**Other Options:**
• Structure of human body → **Anatomy**.
• Secret of handwriting → **Graphology**.
• Teaching of pictures and models → **Iconography/Pedagogy**.

It is a core sub-field of linguistics and library science.

questions.text: The study related to the plants being used as vegetable is called
questions.solution:
✅ **Correct Answer: Olericulture (D)**

**Deep Explanation:** Olericulture is the science and practice of **vegetable growing**, including production, harvesting, storage, and marketing of vegetables.

**Option-wise Analysis:**
• **Floriculture (A):** Flowers and ornamental plants.
• **Pomology (B):** Fruits and fruit crops.
• **Horticulture (C):** Broad garden cultivation (umbrella term).

Olericulture is vital for food security and nutrition.

questions.text: Which one of the following is produced through Viticulture?
questions.solution:
✅ **Correct Answer: Grapes (D)**

**Deep Explanation:** Viticulture is the cultivation and study of **grapevines** (**Vitis vinifera**) for table grapes, raisins, and wine production.

**Other Options:**
• Silk → Sericulture.
• Earthworm → Vermiculture.
• Honey → Apiculture.

Viticulture is central to the global wine industry.

questions.text: What is Vermiculture?
questions.solution:
✅ **Correct Answer: The science of raising worms (A)**

**Deep Explanation:** Vermiculture is the controlled breeding and rearing of earthworms (especially **Eisenia fetida**) for production of **vermicompost** (organic manure) and soil health improvement.

**Option-wise Analysis:**
• **Zoology (B):** General study of animals.
• **Ichthyology/Pisciculture (C):** Fishes.
• No scientific term for “killing worms.”

It is a key component of organic and sustainable farming.

questions.text: In Vermiculture, the worm used is
questions.solution:
✅ **Correct Answer: Earthworm (D)**

**Deep Explanation:** The most commonly used species is the red wiggler earthworm (**Eisenia fetida**) because of its rapid reproduction and efficient organic waste conversion into nutrient-rich vermicast.

**Other Options:**
• Tapeworm & Threadworm → Parasitic (harmful).
• Silkworm → Used in sericulture for silk.

Earthworms improve soil aeration, microbial activity, and nutrient cycling.

questions.text: The study of Gerontology, is related to which of the following?
questions.solution:
✅ **Correct Answer: Old age (D)**

**Deep Explanation:** Gerontology is the multidisciplinary scientific study of **ageing processes**, physical, mental, and social changes in elderly people, and ways to improve quality of life in later years.

**Option-wise Analysis:**
• Child infant → Paediatrics/Geriatrics (opposite).
• Female → Gynaecology.
• Disease of skin → Dermatology.

It overlaps with but is broader than clinical geriatrics.

questions.text: Genetics deals with
questions.solution:
✅ **Correct Answer: Heredity and variations (D)**

**Deep Explanation:** Genetics is the broad scientific study of **genes, heredity, genetic variation**, and how traits are passed from parents to offspring at molecular, cellular, organismal, and population levels.

**Option-wise Analysis:**
• Mendel’s law → One specific set of principles within genetics.
• Organic evolution → Evolutionary biology (uses genetics).
• DNA structure → Molecular biology (part of genetics).

Heredity + variation is the complete core definition.

questions.text: The branch of study dealing with old age and ageing is called
questions.solution:
✅ **Correct Answer: Gerontology (B)**

**Deep Explanation:** Gerontology scientifically investigates all aspects of **ageing** — biological, psychological, sociological — and develops strategies for healthy ageing and elderly care.

**Option-wise Analysis:**
• **Oncology (A):** Study of cancer.
• **Teratology (C):** Study of birth defects/abnormal development.
• **Ornithology (D):** Study of birds.

Gerontology is increasingly important with global population ageing.
